column4: Hi, I'm playing snes games with ZSNES, but the picture is stretched to fit the widescreen. Can I prevent this? I have the 10.6 ati proprietary driver installed.
maybe it has an option to play in a window rether than fullscreen
it is, but I prefer fullscreen
well you can't have your cake and eat it too
make sure all mesa packages are installed
if I try to install -swx11 it wants to remove ubuntu-desktop and libgl1-mesa-glx
pk then do not install that last one ...
well fglrx works, but performance is not as smoot (for compiz) with it
dunno maybe znes look for it as different name? what is the exact message of znes?
I also think it's a linker problem
I now have fglrx installed so I cannot reproduce the error
well libgl1-mesa-glx should porvide libGL for the opensource driver afaics
I think this is my solution-> "After the link is manually created by issuing `ln -s /usr/lib/opengl/ati/lib/libGL.so.1.2 /usr/lib/libGL.so.1.2' everything works asexpected."
